results.title: Getting court
results.creator_credit: Debra Annear, Mozo Films and David Tiley
results.brief_description: Tony is involved in car crash and required to appear in court, charged with careless driving. This program explains what is involved in the process and includes helpful advice from a magistrate on what to expect and how to prepare for a court appearance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debra Annear, Mozo Films and David Tiley

results.title: Getting court
results.brief_description: Shayne steals a car and is charged with car theft and drunk driving. His friend encourages him to seek legal aid and we follow him into court. An excellent program on stealing and the law.

results.title: Getting away
results.brief_description: Gladys Riggs, bored with her family life in a caravan park, plans to “escape” with a travelling salesman. However, her attempts are thwarted when her son decides to come along. Based on a short story by G. Dorothy Thomas.

results.title: Getting around in French
results.creator_credit: Educational TV Services and Harry Mehlman
results.brief_description: Students from Assumption College, Kilmore and Nunawading HIgh School are shown in a number of situations using French language skills they have acquired from the Eclair French language course. Various situations are depicted and the program concludes with students giving their opinions on the Eclair course of study.

results.title: Getting around
results.creator_credit: Robin James, Asian Studies Council, Griffith University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
In this Chinese language program, Professor Colin Mackerras explores the Public Transport system in Beijing. This is heavily used as cars are a rarity. Buses are in great demand and overcrowded. Trains are more modern and luxurious by comparison, while bicycles are by far the most common form of transport. This episode illustrates the vocabulary and protocols required to use the Public Transport system effectively. Presents a sequence looking at the history of the Chinese Language and the confusion which can arise when words sound the same but have different meaning.

results.title: Getting anxious
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Everyone suffers from anxiety occasionally but for 10% of the community anxiety can lead to helpless panic which prevents them from participating in everyday life. This program studies the effects of different types of panic disorders and, using interviews with patients, discusses the different types of treatment available.

results.title: Getting along
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “Time to grow”.
This program contains a discussion on the development of empathy, altruism and understanding of others in middle-childhood. It includes the effects of television, an interview of siblings of an autistic child and how to combat development of hostile or aggressive behaviour.

results.title: Getting a handle on stress with Heidi Di Santo
results.brief_description: Stress is a part of most people’s lives and can be traced back to the fight or flight instincts in prehistoric days. Today this problem is confounded by the fact that we are not as reliant on the fight or flight mechanism, and the societal pressures that contribute to stress levels. This program covers areas such as the effects of long term stress, telltale signs that you are suffering from stress, the importance of identifying how you individually react to stress. It also interviews people who have suffered from serious stress and how it has affected their lifestyle, as well as covering the areas of relaxation, disassociation, sleep, exercise, diet, and the dynamic relationship between thought, feeling and reaction. The video is designed to be integrated with the teachers guide and participant workbooks (available as a separate loan item), as part of a 2-4 hour training session on handling stress.
